title: Complaining about too many passwords
context: Express frustration that you have to reset your password every thirty days.

content.bestLine: I'm so tired of resetting my password every 30 days

neutral.text: I have too many passwords to keep track of
I wish I didn't have to change my password so often
I'm having trouble keeping up with all these passwords
Can't I just use one password for everything?
I'm so done with password resets
Why do I need to reset my password so frequently?

informal.text: Can't they just make passwords simpler?
I'm so sick of forgetting my passwords
Why do passwords have to be so complicated?
I wish I could just use my fingerprint or something
I'm tired of dealing with all these password issues

formal.text: I am experiencing difficulties with frequent password resets
The current password policy is causing me inconvenience
I would appreciate it if password resets could be less frequent
The password reset process is becoming burdensome
I am finding it challenging to manage multiple passwords
Perhaps a more streamlined password system could be implemented

slang.text: I'm low-key done with all these passwords
Can't they just make passwords more turnt?
I'm high-key frustrated with password resets
I'm ghosting all these password resets

sarcastic.text: I'm so excited to reset my password again
I'm just thrilled to be dealing with password issues
Password resets are the highlight of my day

patterns.template: Why do I need to [options] my password so often?
patterns.meaning: questioning the frequency of password resets

dialogs.description: Talking to a friend about password resets

lines.speaker: Person A
lines.text: I'm so tired of resetting my password every 30 days

lines.speaker: Person B
lines.text: I feel you, it's so annoying

dialogs.description: Complaining to a coworker about password resets

lines.speaker: Person A
lines.text: Ugh, I just had to reset my password again

lines.speaker: Person B
lines.text: Yeah, I know, it's such a pain
